top_comments.comment: Bantock, Celtic Symphony, last movement. Rachmaninov, O Mother of God vigilantly praying. Rued Langgaard, String Quartets 2, 3, 6 and Variations on 'Mig Hjertellig nu Lenges'. Petris Vasks, violin concerto, Distant Light. Mendelssohn, Sonata in B flat. Some of my favourite underrated works for classical music.

Hey guys,  Last Night of the Proms “Jerusalem”. Words William Blake/Milton n music Hubert Parry.  Check out the composition it’s beautiful. Back in the 80’s on the river in Cambridge, as the punt in front of us stopped under a bridge, a girl got up from the stern and sang Jerusalem. Phenomenal acoustics. It was a golden moment that still transports me to another world.
I just want to hang out with you two. I think your enthusiasm is infectious. I love your personal comments. I will bring the beer and listen to clips for an evening?

comments_since_last_sample.body: Bantock, Celtic Symphony, last movement. Rachmaninov, O Mother of God vigilantly praying. Rued Langgaard, String Quartets 2, 3, 6 and Variations on 'Mig Hjertellig nu Lenges'. Petris Vasks, violin concerto, Distant Light. Mendelssohn, Sonata in B flat. Some of my favourite underrated works for classical music.
